main_topic: Number Theory: Prime Numbers, Modular Arithmetic, and Cryptography Applications
description: An exploration of key concepts in number theory, focusing on prime numbers, modular arithmetic, and their applications in cryptography.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Prime Numbers
subtopics.description: This subtopic introduces prime numbers, defining them as natural numbers greater than 1 that have no positive divisors other than 1 and themselves. Key concepts include the Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic, which states that every integer greater than 1 can be expressed uniquely as a product of prime numbers. Common misconceptions include the belief that 1 is a prime number. Example problems will include identifying prime numbers within a range.

subtopics.title: Properties of Prime Numbers
subtopics.description: This subtopic covers important properties of prime numbers, including the distribution of primes, the Sieve of Eratosthenes for finding primes, and the concept of twin primes. The subtopic will also address the Prime Number Theorem, which describes the asymptotic distribution of prime numbers. Example problems will involve calculating the number of primes less than a given number.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Modular Arithmetic
subtopics.description: This subtopic introduces modular arithmetic, defining it as a system of arithmetic for integers where numbers wrap around after reaching a certain value (the modulus). Key concepts include congruences, the notation a ≡ b (mod m), and basic operations such as addition, subtraction, and multiplication in modular systems. Example problems will illustrate simple calculations in modular arithmetic.

subtopics.title: Properties and Theorems in Modular Arithmetic
subtopics.description: This subtopic explores essential properties and theorems in modular arithmetic, including the properties of congruences, the concept of the multiplicative inverse, and Fermat's Little Theorem. The subtopic will also discuss how to solve linear congruences. Example problems will include finding inverses and solving congruences.

subtopics.title: Applications of Modular Arithmetic in Cryptography
prerequisites: Properties and Theorems in Modular Arithmetic
subtopics.description: This subtopic examines how modular arithmetic is applied in cryptography, focusing on public key cryptography systems such as RSA. Key concepts include key generation, encryption, and decryption processes. The subtopic will also cover the importance of prime numbers in generating secure keys. Example problems will involve encrypting and decrypting simple messages using RSA.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Cryptography
prerequisites: Applications of Modular Arithmetic in Cryptography
subtopics.description: This subtopic provides an overview of cryptography, defining it as the practice of securing communication through encoding messages. Key concepts include symmetric vs. asymmetric cryptography, digital signatures, and hash functions. The subtopic will also touch on the importance of number theory in ensuring data security. Example problems will involve understanding different cryptographic techniques.

subtopics.title: Advanced Cryptographic Techniques
subtopics.description: This subtopic delves into advanced cryptographic techniques, including elliptic curve cryptography and quantum cryptography. Key concepts include the mathematical foundations of these techniques and their implications for future security. The subtopic will also address potential vulnerabilities and the importance of ongoing research in cryptography. Example problems will involve analyzing the security of various cryptographic methods.
